Description: Silver sistrum; handle (which does not belong?) moulded; the upper part has four cross-bars inserted, each bent round at the ends in the form of waterfowl's heads, and on the top is a small figure of a cat, lying down; the sides are engraved with a lozenge-pattern between borders of vandyke-pattern; phallus added in relief at the base of one side.
Bibliographic references: Silver / Catalogue of the Silver Plate (Greek, Etruscan And Roman) in the British Museum (116)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2022-2023 3 Sept-1 Jan, Norwich, Sainsbury Centre, Visions of Ancient Egypt (tour) 2023 28 Jan-29 Apr, Newcastle, Laing Art Gallery, Visions of Ancient Egypt (tour)
Acquisition notes: Previously unregistered. Possibly previously owned by Payne Knight.
